text:
I everybody :grinning:, i have a question about non-HubSpot forms.

*Case description :*
My client have 2 differents HubSpot CRM platforms. We can rename *CRM1* and *CRM2*.
I developped a simple solution who lead the choice to users if they want to fill CRM1 form or CRM2 form.
That two forms have been *manually created* and are HubSpot one.
In the aim to display that solution i used Google Tag Manager ( Custom HTML bloc ), insertion into all website pages.
Into that website, we have others small HubSpot forms needs to be collected.

*Live result :*
• When i fill *CRM1* form :
    ◦ lead creation into *CRM1* :white_check_mark:
    ◦ new submission into the correct *CRM1* form :white_check_mark:
    ◦ nothing into *CRM2* :white_check_mark:
• When i fill *CRM2* form :
    ◦ lead creation into *CRM2* :white_check_mark:
    ◦ new submission into the correct *CRM2* form :white_check_mark:
    ◦ copy a new form into *CRM1* as external form ( ex : *#hsForm_326fd8a2-9a......* ) :red_circle:
    ◦ copy of a contact into *CRM1* :red_circle:
I searched many solutions to avoid that unwanted information copy into *CRM1*

*I founded 3 main options :*
• Use a trick / add that script before HubSpot launch collectedForms script : <script id="CollectedForms-XXXX"></script>, Then it works well, no copy into CRM1 and lead / contact OK. But needs to add into each wordpress pages...
• Desactivate : "Collect data from website forms" from HubSpot settings ( means no data from all externals forms )
• Use Zappier to create correct lead into correct CRM
*Finally what i want :*
• Receive a lead and contact in the correct CRM everytime a user submit each forms.
• Don't block any contact form submission ( i want to receive all forms data from all forms )
• Don't break any form from the website ( HubSpot or wordpress )
Thank you very much to advice me..
Thanks!
Can you build multilevel dynamic pages with custom CRM objects like with HubDB?
I don't think so, how would you even setup "child" CRM objects
Yeah I didn't think it was possible, but it is with HubDB. I just didn't want to clutter up that space.
Yeah I hear ya. I wish there were folders for hubdb
And access control. Just being able to hide them from the marketing team would be good.
Oooh that too
Has anyone used jotform integrated with HubSpot? I set up the connection, but I want responses to go into a specific list . not sure how to do that
Hi <@U05S96AE2N8> - yes, I have. There definitely should be a unique identifier in the submission, that can help you categorise them in specific lists.
how to i get them added to a list though? It seems all submissions just make a "contact"
<@U05S96AE2N8> - there definitely will be a unique identifier for each submission.
<@U01C5SCRUT1> I want to add the submission to a specific Active List in HubSpot . I dont know how to do it
<@U05S96AE2N8> , I can try and help you over a quick screen share call, if you want to.

Would anyone be able to tell me the difference between what HubSpot means by "Basic SEO Recommendations" vs "Advanced SEO Recommendations" when a user moves from CMS Hub Starter to CMS Hub Professional? Thank you.
nvm i got it!!
If you look in the HubSpot Marketplace you find some although I cannot recommend any specific one.
I would recommend you take the HubSpot CMS for Developers course: <https://academy.HubSpot.com/courses/cms-for-developers>
From HubSpot forum: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Is-it-possible-to-batch-update-contacts-using-email-instead-of/m-p/780082/highlight/true#M63017>

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
